column1: 1987JGR....92E.526J|1987|A potpourri of regolith breccias: "new" samples from the Apollo 14
column12: David T.|Journal of Geophysical Research|92||E526|Compositional (by INAA) and petrographic studies were performed among the smaller rocks (not analyzed previously) from the Apollo 14
column14: and 17 sites as part of a search for regolith samples exotic to the small traverse areas associated with these missions. Of the 40 samples studied
column16: three of the Apollo 14 samples proved to be compositionally unique
column18: which is radically different from all other Apollo 14 regolith materials (lower Mg and Fe
column19: far higher Al and far lower REE abundances)
column20: and is probably exotic to the Apollo 14 traverse area. Among 10 samples from Apollo 17
column21: all but one proved to be typical Apollo 17 regolith breccia. However
column23: 10 sample is more than 99 percent pure pyroclastic glass
column24: compositionally identical to the Apollo 17 orange glass obtained at a location 4 km away
column25: attesting to the widespread distribution of orange glass deposits.|http://dx.doi.org/10.1029/JB092iB04p0E526
